A combination of use, form, and intensity standards not reflected in any existing zoning district. Rezoning to a flex district may only be initiated by the planning board or city council as part of an annexation, rezoning after concept review, or area plan, and upon the determination that the flex zone would implement the goals of the Boulder Valley Comprehensive Plan. When rezoning to a flex district, the rezoning ordinance shall identify the specific use, form, and intensity modules which shall be identified on the official zoning map. Nothing in this section shall be construed to prevent city council from creating new zoning districts
